description: Portugal’s biggest opposition party said it won’t exclude the possibility of proposing a censure motion against Prime Minister Luis Montenegro, who’s been facing questions about potential conflicts of interest related to a family-owned company.
title: Portugal’s Opposition Socialists Won’t Rule Out Censure Motion

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove previews the tariffs being rolled out by the Trump administration. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tariff Wave Starting to Crest as Canada, Mexico to Get Hit

description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. approved a proposal to rescind a Biden-era policy that required US bank mergers to face steeper regulatory scrutiny.
title: FDIC Approves Rollback of Biden-Era Bank Merger Plan

description: Canada has prepared a sweeping package of counter-tariffs against US-made products, its foreign minister said, after President Donald Trump confirmed his administration will go ahead with duties against Canada and Mexico on Tuesday.
title: Canada Is Ready to Retaliate Against US Tariffs, Foreign Minister Says

description: Shortly before US President Donald Trump is expected to clarify whether he will subject his neighbors to 25% tariffs, Mexico announced it was launching an investigation into dumping by the Chinese and Vietnamese governments of one kind of imported steel.
title: Mexico Starts Dumping Investigation Into Chinese Laminated Steel

description: Libya launched its first tender for energy exploration since before the 2011 civil war, as the OPEC member seeks to lure back oil and gas majors following years of political instability and production shutdowns.
title: Libya Launches First Oil Exploration Tender Since Civil War

description: President Donald Trump tore into Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy again Monday, saying “this guy doesn’t want there to be peace.”
title: Trump Challenges Zelenskiy for Saying War’s End Is Far Away

description: President Donald Trump said the US would impose tariffs on “external” agricultural products starting on April 2, his latest threat to impose trade barriers on imported goods.
title: Trump Says Tariffs on Agricultural Imports to Start April 2

description: The National Science Foundation is rehiring about half of the 170 people it fired two weeks as part of an effort to shrink federal agencies.
title: National Science Foundation Rehires 84 People Fired Last Month

description: Donald Trump’s proposed critical minerals deal with Ukraine isn’t enough of a security guarantee in any peace plan to ensure Russia doesn’t strike again, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday, in a clear sign that European leaders intend to push the US president to offer a stronger defensive backstop.
title: UK Sees Ukraine Mineral Deal as Insufficient US Security Promise

description: Even as President Donald Trump froze US foreign aid and began dismantling the US Agency for International Development, his top diplomat Marco Rubio promised that waivers would ensure that “life-saving” assistance continued.
title: Rubio Move Failed to Protect Life-Saving Aid, USAID Official Says

description: President Donald Trump tore into Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy again Monday, saying “this guy doesn’t want there to be peace.”
title: Trump Tears Into Zelenskiy for Saying the End of War Is Far Away

description: Gabon’s military leader Brice Oligui Nguema has announced his candidacy for presidential elections scheduled for next month.
title: Gabon Junta Leader Announces His Candidacy for April Elections

description: Jay Bhattacharya, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the US National Institutes of Health, will tell senators this week that he plans to establish a culture of “scientific dissent” at the agency.
title: Trump’s NIH Pick Urges ‘Scientific Dissent’ in Senate Hearing Remarks

description: The European Union is considering helping finance central-east nations to store natural gas in Ukraine next winter.
title: EU Weighs Funding Central-East Nations to Store Gas in Ukraine

description: Namibia will issue visas on arrival from April 1 for international investors and tourists, as part of a strategy to attract foreign capital.
title: Namibia to Issue Visas on Arrival From April to Lure Investors

description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is offering eligible employees a $50,000 incentive to resign or retire by April 4, according to an email reviewed by Bloomberg.
title: SEC Dangles $50,000 Incentive for Employees to Resign or Retire

description: Nigel Farage’s decision to blame Volodymyr Zelenskiy for the disastrous outcome of his meeting on Friday with US President Donald Trump laid bare a split in the right of UK politics that threatens to cost support for his Reform UK Party.
title: Farage Response to Trump-Zelenskiy Row Shows Split in UK Right

description: The groundwork for Andrew Cuomo’s bid for New York City mayor was laid as he made his way through power breakfasts at the Loews Regency, Upper East Side living rooms and the 92nd Street Y.
title: Cuomo Wins Backers From Blankfein to Langone for NYC Mayor

description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. plans to invest $100 billion in chips plants in the US over the next four years, a move President Donald Trump is set to announce at the White House later Monday, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: TSMC Poised to Announce $100 Billion Investment in US Plants

description: Elon Musk took aim at the Federal Reserve in a post on X Sunday, calling the US central bank “absurdly overstaffed.”
title: Musk Repeats Claim That Fed Is ‘Absurdly Overstaffed’

description: A new Europe-wide multilateral development bank is in talks with the US and other governments to push for a massive security spending boost, according to a former NATO official spearheading the initiative.
title: New Defense Bank Plans to Unlock Funds for European Rearmament

description: President Gabriel Boric’s popularity was unscathed by Chile’s biggest blackout in over a decade, as the nation works to find those responsible for a rare failure that left most of the population in the dark and halted the world’s largest copper mines.
title: Chile President Boric Withstands Fallout From Massive Blackout

description: The United Nations nuclear watchdog called on the US and Iran to begin talks, suggesting that US President Donald Trump holds the next move in trying to defuse tensions with the Islamic Republic over its atomic activities.
title: Nuclear Watchdog Says Trump Looms Large Over Next Steps in Iran

description: US President Donald Trump has long said he would negotiate a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. In pursuit of a deal, the US has engaged in direct discussions with Kremlin officials, with Ukraine and European powers sidelined from the talks.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Attacks Ukraine’s Zelenskiy

description: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at a rapid shift in sentiment about the US economy. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.
title: US Narrative Veers From ‘Exceptionalism’ to Alarm Over Growth

description: President Donald Trump is bending Congress to his will, hobbling minority Democrats with an everything-at-once strategy and rallying fractious Republicans behind his politically risky tax cut plan and billionaire Elon Musk’s cost-cutting crusade.
title: Trump Bends Congress to His Will on Spending, Tax Cut Agenda

description: The French government is looking at how to create leeway to raise defense spending as the need to rein in the country’s surging deficit and borrowing costs weigh on its options.
title: France Seeks Ways to Lift Defense Spending as It Tackles Deficit

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Ukrainians Brace for Donald Trump’s Russia Endgame

description: President Donald Trump’s immigration detentions ticked down after a fast start in his first few days in office.
title: Trump Immigration Detentions Slow Amid Rising ICE Frustration

description: Spanish private equity firm Nazca Capital is working on its first fund to invest in defense companies.
title: Spain’s Nazca Capital Launches €400 Million Defense Fund

description: More than five months after elections, Austria appointed a conservative-led government entrusted with pulling the economy out of recession while cutting the budget deficit and reversing a surge in right-wing populism.
title: Austria Installs New Cabinet in Shadow of Recession, Far Right

description: Ireland’s government will propose changes to its rules for sending troops abroad, as the neutral country ramps up its practical support for Ukraine.
title: Ireland Plans to Ease Defense Rules to Support Ukraine

description: Only a couple years ago, manufacturers were fighting for space to relocate their operations to Monterrey, an industrial city in Mexico’s northeast, as they sought to move closer to the US and its vast consumer market. These days, real estate agents are offering flexible rental plans to keep businesses in the area.
title: Mexico’s Star Economy Dreams Crumble Under Donald Trump’s Tariff Threats

description: The two parties likely to form Germany’s next government led by the conservative Friedrich Merz are exploring options for large-scale investments in defense and infrastructure as Europe eyes massive spending to boost the continent’s security.
title: Germany Explores Options for Defense and Infrastructure Spending

description: Ukraine’s dollar bonds slid the most since last year’s restructuring as divisions between the US and Europe on the peace process shook investors expecting an orderly move toward a ceasefire.
title: Ukraine Bonds Drop as Trump Feud Shakes Up East European Trades

description: The African National Congress, South Africa’s largest political party, appointed Zuko Godlimpi as head of its economic transformation committee in an overhaul of its internal structures.
title: South Africa’s Biggest Party Appoints New Economic Policy Chief

description: A majority of Canadian consumers said they’ve pulled back on buying US-made products and are shopping less on Amazon.com Inc. since US President Donald Trump escalated his threats against Canada.
title: Canadians Shun Amazon in Consumer Protest Against US, Poll Finds

description: Iran’s veteran diplomat Mohammad Javad Zarif stepped down as vice president a day after parliament ousted the finance minister, signaling a growing rift between hardliners and moderates in the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran’s Vice President Javad Zarif Resigns From Government

description: Europe’s ability to stand up for itself as US tariffs loom requires a new playbook.
title: Europe Needs Nerves of Steel Against Trade Coercion

description: Norway needs to avoid revisiting the issue of a potential European Union membership at a time of growing geopolitical tensions due to the risk of sowing more division in society, Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store said.
title: Norway Premier Rejects EU Membership Debate as Too Polarizing

description: Japan’s top spokesman put a positive spin on the Oval Office sparring between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, calling it a step on the road toward resolving the conflict in Ukraine.
title: Japan Hopes US-Ukraine Spat Just Part of Process of Ending War

description: China is considering retaliatory measures on US agriculture and food products in response to tariffs from the Trump administration that are scheduled to take effect on Tuesday, according to the Global Times.
title: China May Hit US Crops in Tariff Response, Global Times Says
